title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit  
00:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:37 <vmassol> has quit  
00:40 <jvdrean> has quit

01:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:38 <vmassol> has quit  
01:44 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:38 <vmassol> has quit  
03:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
03:39 <vmassol> has quit  
04:07 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:11 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
04:39 <vmassol> has quit  
05:37 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
05:41 <vmassol> has quit  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <vmassol> good morning  
08:11 <vmassol> hmm seems we still have some problems on xwiki.or  
08:11 <vmassol> org  
08:11 <vmassol> for ex on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome the panels are missing now  
08:12 <vmassol> the download panel is also missing from all wikis  
08:14 <vmassol> going to restart xwiki.org to see if it helps  
08:17 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> doesn't help  
08:21 <vmassol> any idea?  
09:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <vmassol> guys, we have some issue on xwiki.org (XWiki 4.3)  
09:24 <vmassol> on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome for example the panels are no longer displayed  
09:25 <vmassol> they are listed in XWikiPreferences though  
09:25 <vmassol> they were working yesterday just after the upgrade  
09:26 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Panels/QuickLinks is strangely empty  
09:26 <vmassol> it wasn't yesterday and there have been no edits  
09:27 <vmassol> even worse, on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome the download panel is not displayed for example  
09:30 <Enygma`> vmassol: maybe due to the deletions from yesterday  
09:30 <vmassol> Enygma`: I don't think so  
09:30 <vmassol> "even worse, on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome the download panel is not displayed for example"  
09:31 <Enygma`> this is why xwiki:Panels.Download  
09:31 <Enygma`> checking  
09:32 <Enygma`> ah, it`s there  
09:32 <vmassol> yes all panels are there  
09:32 <vmassol> this one is even displayed on the main wiki itself  
09:33 <Enygma`> so only panels that are cross-wiki (main wiki) are not displayed  
09:33 <Enygma`> re quick links: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Panels/QuickLinks?viewer=history&showminor=true  
09:34 <Enygma`> it seems that when you`ve restored the panel from recycle bin, something went wrong.  
09:34 <vmassol> re quick links on dev I have no clue what's happening  
09:34 <vmassol> it was ok  
09:34 <vmassol> 100% sure  
09:34 <Enygma`> just restore the previous version  
09:34 <vmassol> don't touch it  
09:34 <vmassol> I'd like to check the db first  
09:35 <Enygma`> hm, if you compare versions it shows the content as being deleted  
09:35 <Enygma`> if you open the revision, the panel is empty  
09:35 <vmassol> yes I know  
09:35 <Enygma`> so yea... funky stuff  
09:36 <Enygma`> and this is probably only for the undeleted files (restored from recycle bin), right?  
09:37 <vmassol> I restored 230+ files using teh same technique as we do when clicking on undelete in the ui  
09:37 <vmassol> with this: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Restore+Documents  
09:40 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:58 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> I'm going in a meeting for most of the day unfortunately  
09:59 <vmassol> could someone check this out and try to find why the panels are not displayed?  
10:10 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <cjd> I have a question about rendering, how would I go about getting a reference for a link?  user inputs  "attach:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)" and I want a proper AttachmentReference  
10:45 <cjd> can Rendering do that?  
10:53 <cjd> yay it works :)  
10:54 <polx> has quit  
10:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <autoditac> hello everyone!  
11:16 <autoditac> can i configure xwiki to be a closed wiki, i.e. let only logged in users view wiki pages?  
11:17 <evalica> autoditac: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/SettingUserRights  
11:17 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights  
11:18 <vmassol> (needs to be added to this doc if not there already: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights )  
11:20 <autoditac> thanks, that was easy :)  
11:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:25 <zykes-> How can I edit the text on the main page without borking tjhe dashboarD?  
12:35 <sburjan> zykes-: if you edit Main.WebHome you will see on the right side, in one of the panels, and information telling that Main.WebHome includes a page called Dashboard.WebHome  
12:35 <sburjan> edit Dashboard.WebHome if you want to make customizations to Main.WebHome  
12:36 <zykes-> But is the text "Welcome to your wiki" stored there as wel l?  
12:39 <zykes-> sburjan: ?  
12:39 <sburjan> zykes-: actually all you have is to edit Main.WehBome using InlineEditor  
12:39 <sburjan> edit-> Inline editor  
12:39 <sburjan> and delete the Gadget  
12:40 <zykes-> what if one wants to use the gadgets then ?  
12:41 <sburjan> zykes-: don't confuse dashboards with gadgets  
12:42 <zykes-> but hmm, sburjan if I go to edit it I just get this: http://pastebin.com/TNedjrzy  
12:42 <sburjan> zykes-: you have to edit in Inline mode, not Wiki mode  
12:43 <zykes-> not available to a standard user ?  
12:44 <sburjan> what happens when you click on edit ? you get the above content from the link you pasted ?  
12:45 <sburjan> zykes-: switch your user to Advanced User : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HSimpleandAdvancededitingmodes  
12:45 <zykes-> WYSIWYG  
12:45 <sburjan> and then you'll have more Edit options, and select Inline editor  
12:46 <zykes-> ah, Main.Welcome!  
12:46 <sburjan> depends what you want to do. :)  
12:54 <zykes-> sburjan: damn, your product is freakin' smooth!  
13:01 <sburjan> zykes-: glad you like it :)  
13:04 <autoditac> has quit  
13:12 <zykes-> sburjan: where do I edit the $msg.get('platform.dashboard.wiki.welcome')  
13:16 <polx> has quit  
13:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <sburjan> zykes-: why do you want to edit that ? Do you want to remove the Welcome title ?  
13:34 <zykes-> Change it  
13:34 <zykes-> :)  
13:35 <sburjan> you can remove the existing title and put what you want  
13:35 <evalica> zykes-: remove the $msg and replace it with your text. "$msg" keys are used for internationalization - if you want to have your wiki in multiple languages  
13:35 <zykes-> ah  
13:39 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <DavidCAT> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <mflorea> has quit  
14:11 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <jvelo> Hi Enygma`  
14:40 <jvelo> Shoudln't we have a Solr module on extensions.xwiki.org ?  
14:44 <Enygma`> hi jvelo, yes, we`ll have one eventually :)  
14:45 <jvelo> I'm asking because I'm learning how to query for objects and I need a place to document my findings :)  
14:45 <jvelo> I might create it this afternoon  
14:46 <Enygma`> ok  
14:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <mflorea> has quit  
14:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <mflorea> has quit  
14:58 <mflorea1> has quit  
15:03 <jvelo> Enygma`: does querying for property from the UI work ?  
15:03 <jvelo> I'm querying "unpublished" on type document, I get Blog.BlogIntroduction  
15:03 <jvelo> I try this on object property, I get nothing  
15:04 <jvelo> is that expected ? or I'm doing something wrong?  
15:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <Enygma`> jvelo: you should find it. If you want some debug help in the UI, add the &debug=true parameter to the URL  
15:05 <jvelo> yep, added that  
15:06 <jvelo> parsed query is :  
15:06 <jvelo> (+DisjunctionMaxQuery((class:unpublish^0.5 | propertyvalue:unpublish^1.25 | space:unpublish^0.5 | type:unpublish | creator:unpublish | objcontent:unpublish^0.75 | author:unpublish | mimetype:unpublish | doccontent:unpublish^1.25 | title:unpublish^1.5 | name:unpublish | filename:unpublish^1.25 | attcontent:unpublish^0.75 | comment:unpublish^0.85 | wiki:unpublish^0.5 | fullname:unpublish)))/no\_coord  
15:06 <Enygma`> jvelo: you could also try \*:\* to see all the entries in the query  
15:06 <Enygma`> s/query/index/  
15:07 <jvelo> Ok I have the feeling it brings back just documents  
15:07 <jvelo> do you display object/props differently ?  
15:08 <Enygma`> yes, they should have a different icon  
15:08 <jvelo> ok  
15:08 <Enygma`> I think I have also noticed a problem with quering for properties  
15:08 <Enygma`> but I`ll have to debug it  
15:08 <jvelo> trying to reindex everything  
15:08 <jvelo> still the same  
15:08 <jvelo> it's strange I have only 29 entries in the whole index  
15:08 <Enygma`> did you try \*:\* ?  
15:09 <jvelo> yes  
15:09 <jvelo> it gives 29 documents  
15:09 <Enygma`> are you displaying hidden documents?  
15:09 <jvelo> where do you see that ?  
15:11 <jvelo> I'm displaying all types, all spaces, etc  
15:11 <jvelo> but I see nothing about hidden docs  
15:12 <jvelo> in fact even without a filtered search I get 29 resutls  
15:14 <jvelo> maybe something broken by the 4.0.0 upgrade.. I'm going to try with XE 4.3  
15:15 <evalica> has quit  
15:18 <polx> has quit  
15:18 <Enygma`> jvelo: I mean from the user profile, did you enable hidden documents?  
15:18 <Enygma`> Solr Search, just like Lucene, considers that when displaying the search results and adds a query filter to exclude hidden documents  
15:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <polx> has quit  
15:20 <jvelo> Enygma`: I'm logged in as Admin  
15:21 <Enygma`> jvelo: yes, but hidden documents is enabled even for admins by default in XWiki  
15:21 <jvelo> ah ok, didn't know that  
15:21 <jvelo> that's good  
15:21 <jvelo> but anyway the blog post is not hidden  
15:21 <jvelo> yep just did that  
15:22 <jvelo> 247 documents  
15:22 <jvelo> better :)  
15:22 <jvelo> this time I get the objects  
15:22 <jvelo> which is strange  
15:22 <Enygma`> yes, as I`ve said, there might be an issue with indexing properties. Will have to verify, but I will be able to do this only on Monday  
15:22 <Enygma`> but you are free to help you :)  
15:23 <jvelo> sure no problem. I'm just trying to figure out what can be relied on and what needs work  
15:23 <jvelo> I might help yes  
15:23 <jvelo> though I don't have too much time  
15:24 <jvelo> Enygma`: I see the object/props when hidden docs are displayed, so this mean those props are well indexed  
15:24 <jvelo> maybe they are indexed as hidden though  
15:24 <Enygma`> do you see it for your document as well?  
15:24 <jvelo> yes  
15:25 <jvelo> let me create a JIRA issue  
15:25 <Enygma`> ok  
15:26 <jvelo> XWIKI-8551  
15:27 <jvelo> I'll update it if the symptoms are not exaclty that  
15:28 <DavidCAT> has quit  
15:43 <jvelo> Enygma`: I'm trying to understand how the query parser works. It uses the string in solrconfig.xml under <str name="qf">, right ?  
15:43 <jvelo> (sorry to harrass you with questions, if you don't have time just let me know)  
15:48 <Enygma`> jvelo: I need to go in 10 minutes and will be able to help you more on Monday. Regarding the qf (Query Field) parameter, that just specifies which are the default fields that solr looks for, when you type in a simple query (like some words)  
15:48 <Enygma`> http://wiki.apache.org/solr/SchemaXml  
15:48 <Enygma`> if you enter only "field:value ... field:value" things into the query, the qf will be ignored and only your requested fields will be queried  
15:48 <jvelo> ah great  
15:49 <jvelo> that's what I wanted to know  
15:49 <Enygma`> gtg  
15:49 <Enygma`> have a nice weekend  
15:49 <jvelo> cool, we can talk more on monday, I'll do my homework ;)  
15:49 <jvelo> have fun  
15:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:48 <msmeria> has quit  
17:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <msmeria> has quit  
17:06 <silviar> has quit  
17:10 <vmassol> ok I'm back from my all day meeting  
17:10 <vmassol> hmm just noticed xwiki.org is still in bad shape  
17:10 <vmassol> has anyone tried to look at what's wrong?  
17:13 <tmortagne1> has quit  
17:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <vmassol> ok restored the panel  
17:24 <vmassol> I have no idea what went wrong that's scary  
17:24 <vmassol> apparently jvdrean is working on understanding the problem with panels display  
17:24 <vmassol> so I'll wait for his analysis  
17:30 <jvdrean> vmassol: indeed, the content of panels written in xwiki/1.0 is not executd  
17:31 <jvdrean> vmassol: I'm working on a fix  
17:31 <vmassol> jvdrean: you mean it's a general bug in 4.3?  
17:31 <vmassol> (not just xwiki.org)  
17:32 <jvdrean> yes  
17:33 <vmassol> ouch…. another reason that we'll need a 4.3.1...  
17:33 <vmassol> so it means I was wrong when I said that yesteday the panels were displayed ok  
17:33 <vmassol> (which is possible)  
17:33 <vmassol> :)  
17:33 <jvdrean> I'm not sure it's related to yesterday's problem on xwiki.org  
17:33 <jvdrean> since the panel was rendered, only the link target was wrong  
17:34 <jvdrean> (if we're talking about the same bug)  
17:34 <vmassol> no I wasn't tlaking about that  
17:34 <vmassol> I thought all the panels were displayed after the 4.3 upgrade  
17:51 <tmortagne> we still have lots of xwiki/1.0 panels on xwiki.org ?  
17:52 <vmassol> probably not  
17:52 <vmassol> but it's good we have some apparently :)  
17:53 <tmortagne> I doubt jvdrean found the issue with xwiki.org  
17:57 <jvdrean> I think I'm gonna go with a revert  
17:58 <jvdrean> a revert of XWIKI-8269  
17:58 <vmassol> is it that bad?  
17:59 <jvdrean> fixing it would mean dealing with xwiki/1.0 in WikiComponents  
18:00 <jvdrean> for no added benefits  
18:00 <jvdrean> I think trying to use UIX for panels was a mistake  
18:00 <vmassol> why?  
18:00 <vmassol> it means UIX is not good enough?  
18:01 <jvdrean> it means UIX requires a syntax with a proper parser  
18:01 <jvdrean> which means a syntax that can be properly parsed  
18:01 <jvdrean> which AFAIK xwiki/1.0 is not  
18:01 <vmassol> I find it a pity to throw everything away  
18:02 <vmassol> have you discussed it with tmortagne?  
18:02 <vmassol> (since you're both at the same place right? :))  
18:02 <jvdrean> we're on the same desk so yes :)  
18:03 <vmassol> for me the question is: do we want panels to be UIX (independently of this 1.0 syntax issue)?  
18:04 <vmassol> if the answer is yes then the new quesiton is: how do we get there?  
18:04 <vmassol> (knowing that 1.0 syntax can still be here for a long time so let's not count on it disappearing)  
18:05 <vmassol> we have a 1.0 parser but it's going to be making mistakes since it's just an emulation mode so we cannot count on this either  
18:05 <tmortagne> what we discussed with JV is not to throw everything away  
18:05 <vmassol> ok  
18:05 <tmortagne> jvdrean: will keep the generic work but for now will get back on the old way of dealing with Panels  
18:05 <jvdrean> yes, the question is, do we want panels to be UIXs  
18:06 <tmortagne> untill we get more time to work on it or we get rid of xwiki/1.0  
18:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: if it's there but not used it's even worse  
18:06 <tmortagne> my idea was to keep it in a branch  
18:06 <vmassol> yes a branch is better  
18:06 <vmassol> but that still doesn't make it a plan  
18:06 <vmassol> for moving to it  
18:07 <tmortagne> it's a good work but xwiki/1.0 introduce so much hacking that to polute completely  
18:07 <tmortagne> so IMO the question about panels being UIX or not can be pushed later  
18:08 <vmassol> btw what does jv's work bring compared to what we had? The ability to add a panel by defining a new UI extension object?  
18:08 <tmortagne> not even  
18:08 <tmortagne> panels were still based on configuration  
18:08 <tmortagne> since you can't easily get rid of that  
18:08 <vmassol> that would have been a nice step forward....  
18:09 <vmassol> (with the issue of ordering though)  
18:09 <vmassol> (but fixable)  
18:09 <tmortagne> yes but it's far from being a priority I think  
18:09 <vmassol> ok so no advzantage?  
18:09 <jvdrean> no real advantage  
18:09 <tmortagne> defining a panels in Java :)  
18:10 <vmassol> jvdrean: so you're coding useless stuff? :)  
18:10 <jvdrean> I considered it as a demo  
18:10 <jvdrean> of the UIX mechanism  
18:10 <jvdrean> :)  
18:10 <jvdrean> "see, it works"  
18:10 <vmassol> a demo is sometihng that sometimes fail  
18:10 <jvdrean> "well .. nope"  
18:10 <vmassol> as we've just experienced  
18:10 <Inge-> has quit  
18:10 <vmassol> :)  
18:10 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
18:11 <vmassol> so ok for branch + rollback  
18:11 <vmassol> just too bad you spent that time on it  
18:11 <vmassol> btw make sure to modify the 4.3 release notes  
18:11 <vmassol> to explain this issue  
18:11 <vmassol> which means that 4.3 cannot be used in production for a lot of people btw....  
18:12 <vmassol> another missed release....  
18:12 <vmassol> well they can upgrade their panels but ....  
18:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: the panels are not changed, it's a bridge  
18:13 <vmassol> I know  
18:13 <vmassol> I meant upgrade by moving from 1.0 syntax to 2.0 or 2.1  
18:13 <tdelafosse> has quit  
18:13 <tmortagne> ok  
18:26 <polx> has quit  
18:28 <vmassol> hmm we could do a similar kind of presentation for XWiki rendering actually ;) http://mojavelinux.github.com/decks/asciidoc-with-pleasure/  
18:28 <vmassol> (thanks to fmancinelli for the link)

23:20 <zykes-> what is struts-form.tld ?  
23:20 <zykes-> sburjan`: you know ?  
23:20 <sdumitriu> zykes-: Delete it  
23:21 <sdumitriu> It's a file that we've never used and was slowing down the startup time  
23:25 <zykes-> http://paste.ubuntu.com/1397910/ < sdumitriu what can these things mean ?  
23:25 <sdumitriu> That you're running out of space  
23:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
23:25 <sdumitriu> In /var/  
23:26 <sdumitriu> (disk space, that is)  
23:28 <zykes-> thanks su  
23:28 <zykes-> sdumitriu:  
23:35 <vmassol> has quit
